item.title: Albertsons 因杂货需求稳定而上调年度利润预期
item.description: Albertsons 周二上调了年度利润和销售预期，理由是尽管消费者预算紧张，但对基本杂货和药店产品的需求稳定。【原文：Albertsons raised its annual profit and sales forecast on Tuesday, citing steady demand for essential groceries and pharmacy products despite tight consumer budgets.】

item.title: 花旗集团利润攀升，收入创历史新高，但墨西哥出售交易拖累利润
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup）公布第三季度利润增长，所有部门的收入均创历史新高，这使得该银行股价在盘前交易中上涨了约 1%。【原文：Citigroup reported a rise in third-quarter profit, as all its divisions brought in record revenue, sending the bank's shares up about 1% in trading before the bell.】

item.title: Nexperia称正与中美两国就出口管制问题进行谈判
item.description: 荷兰计算机芯片制造商 Nexperia 周二表示，该公司正面临美国和中国政府的出口限制。【原文：Dutch computer chip maker Nexperia said on Tuesday it is facing export restrictions from both the U.S. and Chinese governments.】

item.title: BetMGM 计划在今年第 3 次提升利润后向所有者返还至少 2 亿美元
item.description: 周二，美国体育博彩公司 BetMGM 今年第三次上调了其年度收入和利润预期，并表示预计在今年年底前至少向其所有者 Entain 和 MGM Resorts 返还 2 亿美元。【原文：U.S. sports betting firm BetMGM on Tuesday raised its annual revenue and profit forecasts for the third time this year and said it expects to return at least $200 million to its owners - Entain and MGM Resorts - before the end of the year.】

item.title: 高盛利润大增，银行家在大宗交易中套现
item.description: 本周二，高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）的季度利润跃升了 37% 以上，原因是其投资银行家们赚取了更高的顾问费，而交易员们则利用了活跃的市场。【原文：Goldman Sachs' quarterly profit jumped more than 37% on Tuesday as its investment bankers earned higher advisory fees and traders capitalized on active markets.】

item.title: Suedzucker称预计第三季度业绩将有所改善
item.description: 欧洲最大的糖生产商Suedzucker周二表示，由于本季度开局良好，预计将于1月份公布的第三季度业绩将同比有所改善。【原文：Europe's largest sugar producer Suedzucker said on Tuesday it expected to post a year-on-year improvement in its third-quarter results, to be reported in January, citing a positive start to the quarter.】

item.title: 独家报道：博通将推出新网络芯片，与 Nvidia 之争愈演愈烈
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）将于周二推出一款新的网络芯片，通过将数十万个芯片串联起来进行数据运算，帮助企业构建人工智能计算系统，从而加深与英伟达公司（Nvidia）的竞争。【原文：Broadcom is launching a new networking chip on Tuesday that will help companies build artificial intelligence computing systems by stringing together hundreds of thousands of chips that crunch data, deepening its rivalry with Nvidia .】

item.title: 石油行业高管认为中期内市场将从过剩中恢复平衡
item.description: 一系列石油行业高管本周在伦敦表示，全球石油市场将在中长期内趋紧，尽管产量上升导致近期供应过剩，但他们仍保持乐观。【原文：The global oil market will tighten in the medium to longer term, a range of oil industry executives said in London this week, maintaining optimism despite a near-term glut driven by rising output.】

item.title: 英国监管机构支持 "代币化 "基金吸引年轻投资者
item.description: 英国金融监管机构周二制定计划，鼓励资产管理公司在区块链上将其资金 "代币化"，此举旨在吸引年轻投资者。【原文：Britain's financial regulator set out plans on Tuesday to encourage asset managers to "tokenise" their funds on blockchain, in a move aimed at attracting younger investors.】

item.title: 早间竞价：人工智能与贸易博弈，波动加剧
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 通用汽车重新评估电动汽车计划，计提 16 亿美元费用
item.description: 通用汽车（General Motors）周二表示，在一项关键的联邦支持到期后，该公司将重新调整电动汽车计划，第三季度将计提 16 亿美元的费用，预计这将给需求带来压力。【原文：General Motors said on Tuesday it will take $1.6 billion in third-quarter charges as it realigns electric-vehicle plans following the expiration of a key federal support, which is expected to pressure demand.】

item.title: 摩根大通投资银行业务蓬勃发展，交易强劲，利润上升
item.description: 摩根大通第三季度利润增长，主要原因是数十亿美元的交易和首次公开募股推动了其投资银行的发展，同时交易表现也更加强劲。【原文：JPMorgan Chase's profit rose in the third quarter, fueled by multi-billion dollar deals and IPOs that boosted its investment bank, along with stronger trading performance.】

item.title: 富国银行上调资产上限后的回报目标；利润超出预期
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo）周二公布的第三季度利润超出华尔街预期，并上调了备受关注的盈利目标，此前监管机构取消了对该银行的资产上限，为其寻求增长铺平了道路。【原文：Wells Fargo on Tuesday beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit and raised its closely watched profitability target after regulators removed an asset cap imposed on the bank, paving the way for it to pursue growth.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴云业务在迪拜启动第二个数据中心
item.description: 中国电子商务巨头阿里巴巴的云计算业务部门周二表示，其第二个数据中心已在迪拜启动，这是继第一个数据中心启动九年后，阿里巴巴扩大其全球云计算服务以满足日益增长的需求。【原文：Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba's cloud business unit has launched its second data centre in Dubai, it said on Tuesday, nine years after its first, as it expands its global cloud computing services to meet growing demand.】

item.title: J&J 拟分拆骨科业务，上调全年业绩预期
item.description: 强生公司周二在公布了高于华尔街预期的季度收益后，上调了 2025 年的销售预期，并宣布计划将其骨科业务分拆为一家独立公司。【原文：Johnson & Johnson on Tuesday raised its 2025 sales forecast after reporting quarterly earnings that topped Wall Street expectations, and announced plans to spin off its orthopedics business into a standalone company.】

item.title: 美国 9 月小型企业景气度下降，通胀重回焦点
item.description: 由于预计未来六个月的经营状况不佳，9 月份美国小型企业的景气度有所下降，许多企业主表示将提价或计划提价，这表明通胀有望进一步加剧。【原文：U.S. small-business sentiment declined in September amid expectations of unfavorable operating conditions in the next six months, and many owners reported raising prices or planning to, suggesting that inflation was poised to increase further.】

item.title: 独家报道人工智能实验室莱拉科学（Lila Sciences）获得英伟达（Nvidia）的新支持，估值突破13亿美元
item.description: 人工智能初创公司Lila Sciences告诉路透社，该公司在一轮扩展融资中从包括英伟达（Nvidia）风险投资部门在内的投资者那里筹集了1.15亿美元，使其估值超过13亿美元。【原文：AI startup Lila Sciences has raised $115 million in an extension funding round from investors including Nvidia's venture arm, lifting its valuation to more than $1.3 billion, the company told Reuters.】

item.title: Rayonier 和 PotlatchDeltic 将以 82 亿美元合并组建木材产品巨头
item.description: Rayonier 公司和 PotlatchDeltic 公司周二表示，两家公司将进行全股票合并，包括债务在内的合并价值约为 82 亿美元，从而成为北美最大的木材和木制品上市公司之一。【原文：Rayonier and PotlatchDeltic said on Tuesday they will merge in an all-stock deal valued at about $8.2 billion, including debt, to create one of North America's largest publicly traded timber and wood products companies.】

item.title: 美国消费者追求超值餐饮，多米诺比萨季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 本周二，多米诺比萨公司公布的第三季度利润和美国同店销售额均好于预期，原因是在经济不确定的情况下，消费者紧缩预算，促销活动和新菜单项目推动了利润和同店销售额的增长。【原文：Domino's Pizza posted better-than-estimated profit and U.S. same-store sales for the third quarter on Tuesday, driven by promotions and new menu items as consumers tighten their budgets amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 汽车行业破产引发对华尔街信贷风险的新一轮审查
item.description: 汽车相关公司 First Brands 和 Tricolor 的破产，以及银行和投资基金的潜在损失，正在引发人们对部分信贷市场隐藏风险的新担忧--这促使投资者仔细审视高风险债务。【原文：The bankruptcies of automotive-related companies First Brands and Tricolor, along with potential losses at banks and investment funds, are raising new concerns about hidden risks in parts of the credit market — prompting investors to take a closer look at risky debt.】

item.title: 贝莱德第三季度市场反弹，资产达到创纪录的 13.46 万亿美元
item.description: 贝莱德（BlackRock）周二公布第三季度利润增长，原因是全球市场反弹提高了手续费收入，并使其管理资产达到创纪录的 13.46 万亿美元。【原文：BlackRock on Tuesday reported a higher third-quarter profit as a rally in global markets lifted fee income and pushed its assets under management to a record $13.46 trillion.】

item.title: 美国参议员要求商务部对 Megaspeed 进行调查
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一封信，美国共和党参议员汤姆-科顿（Tom Cotton）要求商务部调查新加坡 Megaspeed 公司涉嫌挪用用于人工智能的英伟达（Nvidia）芯片一事。【原文：U.S. Republican Senator Tom Cotton has asked the Commerce Department to investigate Singapore-based Megaspeed for allegedly diverting Nvidia chips used for artificial intelligence, according to a letter seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 美元从竞争对手的困境中获益可能缺乏持久力
item.description: 美元在过去一个月的反弹不太可能持久，因为这主要是由于对临时因素的重新定位，包括美国政府停摆导致美国经济数据中断，以及竞争对手货币政府的动荡。【原文：A rebound in the dollar over the past month is unlikely to last given it was largely due to repositioning over temporary factors including the disruption of U.S. economic data due to the U.S. government shutdown and upheaval in the governments of rival currencies.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔谈经济 在增长、就业和物价风险之间拉锯
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）将于周二发表美联储下次会议前的最后一次讲话，目前经济增长强于预期，生产率近期也有所跃升，但仍在适应关税和移民政策，经济学家担心这些政策可能会导致通胀和失业率上升。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Tuesday delivers his last scheduled remarks before the Fed's next meeting with the economy enjoying stronger-than-expected growth and a recent jump in productivity, but still adjusting to tariff and immigration policies that economists worry could lead to both higher inflation and higher unemployment.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯在分拆前重新谈判 100 亿欧元的 TKMS 担保事宜
item.description: 根据 TKMS 单独上市前的招股说明书，军舰制造商 TKMS 重新谈判了从母公司蒂森克虏伯获得的项目担保条款，这表明该公司在为独立未来做准备时面临着更苛刻的条件。【原文：Warship maker TKMS has renegotiated terms of project guarantees it gets from parent Thyssenkrupp , according to a prospectus ahead of TKMS' separate listing, indicating tougher conditions as the business prepares for a stand-alone future.】

item.title: 阿玛尼的合作伙伴 Dell'Orco 将领导基金会
item.description: 路透社看到的一份文件显示，2016 年成立的乔治-阿玛尼基金会（Giorgio Armani Foundation）已任命阿玛尼的商业和生活伴侣潘塔莱奥-德尔奥尔科（Pantaleo Dell'Orco）为新主席。【原文：The Giorgio Armani Foundation, set up in 2016 and a pillar of the late Italian designer's succession plan, has named Armani's business and life partner Pantaleo Dell'Orco as its new chairman, a document seen by Reuters showed.】

item.title: 欧洲航空公司首席执行官呼吁为实现绿色目标提供更多支持
item.description: 欧洲航空公司的首席执行官们呼吁欧盟提供更多支持，以增加绿色喷气燃料的供应，并为这种燃料的生产提供更好的补贴。【原文：Chief executives of Europe's airlines called for more support from the European Union to increase the supply of green jet fuel and better subsidise the creation of the fuel.】

item.title: 米其林发布盈利预警后股价下跌达 11
item.description: 周二，米其林股价下跌达 11%，跌至近三年来的最低点，原因是这家轮胎制造商因北美业务状况疲软而下调了全年收入预期，降幅超过预期。【原文：Shares in Michelin fell as much as 11% on Tuesday, to their lowest in almost three years, after the tire maker cut its forecast for full-year income more than expected due to weak business conditions in North America.】

item.title: 美国生物技术公司纳布拉生物公司与日本武田公司扩大人工智能药物设计合作关系
item.description: 美国生物技术公司纳布拉生物公司（Nabla Bio）周二表示，它已与日本制药商武田制药公司（Takeda Pharmaceutical）签署了第二份重要的研究合作协议，双方将进一步利用人工智能加速药物研发。【原文：U.S. biotech firm Nabla Bio said on Tuesday it has signed a second major research partnership with Japanese drugmaker Takeda Pharmaceutical , deepening their use of artificial intelligence to accelerate drug discovery.】

item.title: 英国摩根先进材料公司因前景黯淡和芯片业务下滑而暴跌
item.description: 周二，摩根先进材料公司股价下滑近 14%，这家英国芯片零部件供应商预计，由于半导体需求疲软和欧洲工业市场的不确定性增加，该公司的年销售额将低于去年。【原文：Shares of Morgan Advanced Materials slipped nearly 14% on Tuesday after the British chip parts supplier forecast annual sales to be lower than last year due to weak semiconductor demand and growing uncertainty in European industrial markets.】
